alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 8:46AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Davie, Plantation, Dania Beach, Chula Vista, Fort Lauderdale - Hollywood International Airport, Melrose Park, Downtown Fort Lauderdale, Washington Park, Broadview Park, Port Everglades, St. George, Intersection I-595 And I-95, Riverland Village, Boulevard Gardens and Broward Estates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
